item.title: Data Wrangling
item.description: I managed to catch one of NUS Hackers’ workshops, “Hacker Tools: Data Wrangling”, by Julius. I got to learn many new things since I don’t use CLI for text processing. Julius’ slides can be found in his GitHub repo. Below is a very brief and dry summary of what I think are more important to me. If I “miss” something out, it’s likely because I remembered it before. This summary does no justice to the workshop, but I want to write them down here before I forget.
